benchmark_details.name: CCSBench (Compositional Controllable Scientific Summarization)
benchmark_details.overview: CCSBench is the first evaluation benchmark for compositional controllable summarization in the scientific domain, enabling fine-grained control over multiple attributes such as length and empirical focus.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate compositional controllability in scientific document summarization by systematically assessing the ability of LLMs to generate controlled, contextually appropriate scientific summaries.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark presently does not support multilingual scientific summarization.

data.source: Constructed from the arXiv dataset focusing on Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence papers.
data.annotation: Generated using GPT-4 for readability and focus components.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as ROUGE scores are computed to assess fluency and content accuracy.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROUGE scores indicate better summary quality, while lower MAD indicates closer adherence to target lengths.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated various LLMs against the CCSBench benchmark.
methodology.validation: Involves both automated metrics and human evaluations for assessing summary quality.
